generif.text: KLF17 is a new member of the Sp/KLF family of transcription factors.

demonstrate that KLF17 expression is significantly downregulated in primary human breast cancer samples and that the combined expression pattern of KLF17 and Id1 can serve as a potential biomarker for lymph node metastasis in breast cancer
KLF17 has a role in transcriptional regulation of metastasis by Id1 [review]
it is possible that KLF17 inhibits tumor growth in lung adenocarcinoma.
Overall, these findings suggest a repressing role of KLF17 in tumor invasion
KLF17 may have an oncogenic role during EEC progression via initiating EMT through the regulation of TWIST1
KLF17 might be one of the downstream signalling molecules of DJ-1.

The reduced expression of KLF17 protein in gastric cancer was correlated with tumor size, pN stage and lymphovascular invasion and was an independent predictor for poor survival in patients undergoing surgery for gastric cancer.

The reduced expression of KLF17 promoted the motility and proliferation ability of TPC1 cells by altering the expression of tight junction protein 1 and Snai1, and activating the AKT pathway by upregulating inhibitor of DNA binding 1.
mutant p53 enhances cancer progression by inhibiting KLF17 expression in invasive breast carcinoma cells
In this review, we focus on the functions, roles, and regulatory networks of these five KLFs in HCC, summarize key pathways, and propose areas for further investigation
A small subset of Myoepithelial tumors harbor FUS rearrangements, two thirds of them being associated with KLF17 fusion.
KLF17 empowers TGF-beta/Smad signaling by targeting Smad3-dependent pathway to suppress tumor growth and metastasis during cancer progression.
Tumor-suppressive p53 signaling is critical for KLF17 to inhibit cancer metastasis in Non-small Cell Lung Cancer.
Suggest that KLF17 inhibits esophageal carcinoma development and may serve as a potential therapeutic target.

Enhanced KLF17 expression sensitizes ERalpha-positive breast cancer cells to endocrine therapy.KLF17-ERalpha interaction plays a potential role in inhibition of ERalpha-dependent breast cancer progression.
Low Expressions of KLF17 is associated with lung adenocarcinoma.

The above data show that normal levels of melatonin may help in preventing breast cancer metastasis through inhibiting DJ-1/KLF17/ID-1 signaling pathway. The combination of melatonin and taxol is a potent candidate against breast cancer metastasis, better than using melatonin or taxol as a single drug

Results revealed that KLF17 expression was abnormally decreased in colorectal cancer (CRC) and associated with lymph node metastasis and unfavorable overall survival. Moreover, ectopic KLF17 expression suppressed CRC cell growth and invasion in vitro and in vivo. In addition, the downregulation of KLF17 was associated with the hypermethylation of the CpG nucleotides on the KLF17 promoter.
Overexpression of KLF17 Predicts a Favorable Prognosis in Patients with Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma: A Retrospective Study.
Kruppel-like factor 17 upregulates uterine corin expression and promotes spiral artery remodeling in pregnancy.
Precision hyperthermia-induced miRNA-409-3p upregulation inhibits migration, invasion, and EMT of gastric cancer cells by targeting KLF17.
Up-regulation of KLF17 expression increases the sensitivity of gastric cancer to 5-fluorouracil.
KLF17 promotes human naive pluripotency but is not required for its establishment.
Effect of KLF17 overexpression on epithelial-mesenchymal transition of gastric cancer cells.
KLF17 promotes human naive pluripotency through repressing MAPK3 and ZIC2.

BP.term: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

MF.term: RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding
DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific
DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific

name: KLF transcription factor 17
summary: Enables sequence-specific double-stranded DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to act upstream of or within gamete generation. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of chromatin. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
